newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: FCL Energy wins C$220 mln co-generation project.
newsitem.headline: FCL Energy wins C$220 mln co-generation project.

text.p: Fletcher Challenge Energy said on Wednesday it had been named preferred developer for a C$220 million (NZ$230 million) cogeneration project in British Columbia, Canada.
The company said detailed financial arrangements had not yet been determined, but it was envisaged that the project would be financed with non-recourse project-related debt.
The project is to develop a 240-megawatt gas-fired cogeneration facility adjacent to the Elk Falls mill of Fletcher Challenge Paper on Vancouver Island, British Columbia.
FCL Energy is a 60 percent partner in the venture, with 40 percent held by Westcoast Power Inc, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Canadian gas utility Westcoast Energy Inc.
Subject to completion of contractual negotiations and approval from the FCL board, construction is expected to begin in the first half of 1998.
FCL Energy Chief Executive Michael Andrews said the project would be a significant step in the company's growth as an integrated energy company with a strong position in the Canadian industry.
"The project is economically attractive, with a high probability of achieving returns in excess of our cost of capital," he said. -- Wellington newsroom 64 4 4734 746
